fields.summary: VPC - default rule allowing instances in same SG not always present

comments.body:
[root@c-39 ~]# euca-describe-instances  i-2602c796
RESERVATION	r-7729cdd0	789493830604	dan
INSTANCE	i-2602c796	emi-8c60b595	10.116.169.205	172.31.19.169	running	dan	0		m1.small	2015-01-30T19:03:45.419Z	two				monitoring-disabled	10.116.169.205	172.31.19.169	vpc-f2a698aa	subnet-61a5036c	instance-store					hvm			sg-be5b6b96				x86_64
NETWORKINTERFACE	eni-5e3bdec1	subnet-61a5036c	vpc-f2a698aa	789493830604	in-use	172.31.19.169	euca-172-31-19-169.eucalyptus.internal	true
ATTACHMENT		0	attached	2015-01-30T19:03:45.432Z	true
ASSOCIATION	10.116.169.205	eucalyptus	172.31.19.169
GROUP	sg-be5b6b96	dan
PRIVATEIPADDRESS	172.31.19.169	euca-172-31-19-169.eucalyptus.internal	primary
TAG	instance	i-2602c796	euca:node	10.111.5.148
[root@c-39 ~]# 
[root@c-39 ~]# euca-describe-subnets subnet-61a5036c
SUBNET	subnet-61a5036c	available	vpc-f2a698aa	172.31.16.0/20	4090	two	true	true
[root@c-39 ~]# euca-describe-vpcs vpc-f2a698aa
VPC	vpc-f2a698aa	available	172.31.0.0/16	dopt-d99efb60	default	true

Thanks [~sjones].  Confirmed the expected behavior for both default VPC & Security Group as well as non-defaults. In the default case I see the bridge port rule allowing an ip group containing the other members (active VMs) in the security group and confirmed the functionality of the rule. Non-default SGs do not have this rule. 
This issue can be closed or moved for docs reference. 
Thanks!
-M
